meanings.definition: A noncommissioned officer in the military.
meanings.sent1: The noncom gave orders to the soldiers during training.
meanings.sent2: The noncom led the platoon with discipline and expertise.
meanings.sent3: The noncom tried to teach the new recruits to march in a zigzag pattern for fun.
meanings.sent4: The noncom was the backbone of the unit, guiding and supporting the troops.
meanings.sent5: The noncom's presence on the battlefield was reassuring and inspiring.

meanings.definition: A person who does not conform to established rules or standards.
meanings.sent1: The noncom stood out from the crowd with their unique style.
meanings.sent2: Being a noncom in a traditional society can be challenging.
meanings.sent3: The noncom decided to wear mismatched socks to the formal event.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity made her a noncom in the world of fashion.
meanings.sent5: The noncom's rebellious spirit was evident in everything they did.
